revised_title: Observations on the Meridian Line and Inequality of Degrees
tldr: The author reports on the observations made by Monsieur Cassini during his journey to determine the passage of a meridian line from one end of France to the other. He discusses the methods used by ancient and modern astronomers to measure the Earth's dimensions and the possibility of the Earth being flattened at the poles or having an elliptical shape. The author also mentions the observations of the inequality of degrees in the meridian line, which could challenge the Earth's perfect roundness.
